about.dataprivacy: The information on NC COVID Support has been gathered from public web sources by volunteers or entered by business owners/resource providers. The data are provided to assist the public, local businesses, government partners, and non-profits during the COVID-19 pandemic. The data should not be used for commercial ventures or other purposes without the express permission of NC COVID Support.

about.info: Our database of resources benefits from information collected by these organizations:
about.title: About this site

faq.freeMealsAnswer: Use our interactive site to find meals close to you. Click on a distribution site to view its address and operating hours, then pick up free meals in that window.
faq.freeMealsQuestion: How can I get free meals?
faq.helpAnswer-end: so the program can continue as long as it is needed.
faq.helpAnswer-start:
Share our meal site on social media and text your friends! Every tweet and facebook post lets us help more families. Let's get everyone excited about Meals For Families!
Please also consider donating to the
faq.staySafeReminder: Please be sure to wear a mask when visiting a pickup site or interacting with volunteers to help us all stay safe!
faq.title: Info about free meals
faq.whatWeDoAnswer:
We help to connect kids and families with meals in their area.
 We know that School-sponsored meals are a lifeline for many kids and families during the COVID crisis. We're here to help you find them.
faq.whatWeDoQuestion: What does Meals For Families do?
faq.whoAnswer: Free meals are available to any child aged 0-18 years. In some programs, adults may receive meals free or at a reduced price. Call your local meal sites to learn about their policies.
faq.registerQuestion: Does my child have to be registered with the Free & Reduced Lunch program at school to receive a meal?
faq.registerAnswer: No, meals are available to any child aged 0-18 years. No registration is required. However, to help the school district receive funding the meals, eligbile families are encouraged to register for free and reduced priced meals through the USDAâ€™s National School Lunch & School Breakfast Programs. Applications for the UDSA program can be found at lunchapplication.com. You, your children, or other household members do not have to be U.S. citizens to apply for free or reduced price meals.
faq.typeoffoodQuestion: What type of food is provided?
faq.typeoffoodAnswer: Meal sites provide meals to support any child in need. Meals include a healthy lunch, a snack, and a breakfast for the next morning.
faq.preparedmealsQuestion: Are prepared meals the only type of food available?
faq.preparedmealsAnswer: Your local schools often partner with local food pantries to provide families with boxes of produce and non-perishable foods when possible. Call the number associated with a meal site and ask!
faq.adultavaliabilityAnswer: In general, children are the only ones eligible for meals. However, your local meal sites may have different policies. Call a meal site at the number provided to get more specific information.
faq.childrenpresentQuestion: Do children have to be present to pick up meals?
faq.childrenpresentAnswer: No, children do not have to be present to pick up meals. Parents and guardians may pick up meals on behalf of the children.
faq.idQuestion: Do I have to show an ID to pick up meals?
faq.idAnswer: No ID is needed to receive a meal. Meal sites will NOT ask for your name, address, or any other identifying information.
faq.numberofmealsQuestion: How many meals are available at each site?
faq.numberofmealsAnswer: Meals are served on a first come, first served basis.
faq.packagingAnswer: Meals are packaged in individually wrapped containers for your safety.
faq.vegetarianQuestion: Do meal sites offer vegetarian meals or meals for special diets?
faq.vegetarianAnswer: Yes, many meal sites offer a vegetarian option for each meal.
faq.babyfoodQuestion: Do meal sites offer baby food?
faq.babyfoodAnswer: Usually, no. Call the meal sites closest to you to ask about their specific policies.
